document.docTitle: Protosticta joepani Dow, Phan & Choong 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Protosticta joepani sp. nov. from Borneo with notes on P. kinabaluensis Laidlaw 1915 (Odonata: Zygoptera: Platystictidae)

, sp. nov.

new species cf
kinabaluensis
;—

species;—

materialsCitation.collectorName: A. Dow & Naturalis Biodiversity Center & Leiden

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype .
1 ♂ (SAR05_PST31), second order tributary to stream with failed small scale hydroelectric dam (ca 3.752N , 115.443E ), Bario , Kelabit Highlands , Miri Division , Sarawak , Malaysia , ca
1,070–1,120m a.s.l.
,
17 v 2005
, leg. R . A. Dow ; deposited at the Naturalis Biodiversity Center ( RMNH ), Leiden , the Netherlands.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 2–5. Heads of
Protosticta
species.
Protosticta joepani
: (2) holotype male, dorsal-frontal view; (4) paratype female used for description, dorsal-frontal view.
Protosticta kinabaluensis
: (3) male (SAB5_PST3), dorsal view; (5) female (SAB12_ PST69), dorsal frontal view.

Etymology.
joepani
, a noun in the genitive case. Named after Pan Tshin Siong (born
5 th March 1950
), an enthusiastic amateur naturalist and photographer of Odonata and other wildlife from Sabah , who uses the name Joe Pan for his social media posts concerning natural history.
